meanings.definition: Showing or indicating deep sorrow or misery
meanings.sent1: The woebegone puppy whimpered in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: Her woebegone expression revealed the sadness she felt inside.
meanings.sent3: Despite his woebegone appearance, he still managed to make us laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood woebegone, its windows shattered and its walls crumbling.
meanings.sent5: The woebegone melody of the song brought tears to everyone's eyes.

meanings.sent1: The woebegone look on her face told us she had received bad news.
meanings.sent2: The woebegone expression on his face made us realize he was in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The woebegone cat refused to eat the new brand of food, turning up its nose at it.
meanings.sent4: The woebegone sky seemed to mirror his gloomy mood as he walked home alone.
meanings.sent5: The woebegone sight of the abandoned puppy tugged at our heartstrings.
